title: Drones On The Range
teaser: Animal rights advocates are using drones to circumvent "ag-gag laws" that disallow them from filming possible abuses.
contentencoded:
Animal rights advocates and some journalists are moving ahead with challenges to so-called “ag-gag laws” that prohibit their filming of livestock operations to uncover possible abuses.

Last week, a federal judge ruled that one such law passed this year in Idaho may be a restriction of free speech and unconstitutional.

Meanwhile, animal welfare activists are employing another method to carry out their “whistleblower” campaigns: unmanned aerial vehicles, more commonly known as drones.

From the Here & Now Contributors Network, Harvest Public Media‘s Peggy Lowe reports.

  • Harvest Public Media: Drone to fly over livestock operations and ‘ag-gag’ laws
